clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Preoperative Information to Parents Before Ear-nose-throat Pediatric Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Preoperative Information to Parents Before Ear-nose-throat Pediatric Surgery on the Parents' Preparedness for Anesthesia

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: Children who will have surgery and need anesthesia, and their parents are often anxious and show signs of stress and discomfort. A main reason for concern and anxiety is fear of anesthesia and surgery, and lack of knowledge of what is going to happen. The purpose of the study is to see if a specific preoperative information brochure aimed at the parents will make the parents feel better prepared for the procedures.

primary_outcome.description: Self-reported satisfaction with provided information on a 5 point Likert scale where 1 is less satisfied and 5 is high satisfaction (range 1-5). In total four questions (sum score range 4-20)

primary_outcome.measure: Preparedness for the operating room setting
primary_outcome.description: Self-reported to what degree parents feel prepared as to what will happen before/during induction of anaesthesia on a 5 point Likert scale where 1 is less prepared and 5 is very well prepared (range 1-5). In total two questions (sum score range 2-10)

secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported perceived stress measured by 14 questions on a 5-point Likert scale where 1 is Never and 5 is very often. Range for the total score is 1-70.

arm_group.description: Intervention: The parents are given a specific information brochure that describes the procedures that the child is going through during anesthesia when it has been decided that the child is going to have the surgery.
Information as usual, i.e. oral information about the procedures to parents when they arrive at the hospital with the child that is going to have the surgery.

intervention.description: A purpose-designed brochure about anesthesia and surgery in the ear in children is developed by the investigators. This brochure has photos and describes the procedures the child is going through.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Parents with children undergoing ear-nose-throat surgery in the study period
Exclusion Criteria:
- Parents who do not speak nor read Norwegian.
- Parents who do not want to participate
